featured.text: More than 2,000 adults took part in the survey to find out about their knowledge of diet, healthcare, disease control, and medication.
Sherlock Holmes, a detective in a popular fiction series, has impressed readers with his amazing powers of _____ and his knowledge of trivial facts.
After she graduates, Deborah plans to use her knowledge to educate people how to best take care of their bodies and cope with the feelings of hopelessness that she remembers so well.
A marine pilot is a boat pilot with specialized knowledge of a particular port or harbor.
The coastal peoples have long passed on knowledge from generation to generation through oral traditions, and totem poles were the traditional way of telling the story of an individual family or clan.

other.text: A marine pilot goes on board at a crucial time and controls the vessel based on his or her knowledge of the port and the situation at hand.
By sharing knowledge and information, the different sectors are able to come up with improved processing and handling, through which creation of various innovative products was made possible.
Which of the following is part of the knowledge that a marine pilot must have? (A)

The feel of a book, the smell, the weight, and the knowledge that a particular book might be more than a hundred years old—all these highlight the importance of preserving the physical book as a complement to technology.
Living in a highly _____ society, you definitely have to arm yourself with as much knowledge as possible.
The broken pieces of knowledge taught at school.
Good work environment and great co-workers Good Knowledge of English.
The basic structure of roads and bridges. (C) Knowledge and regulations about safe driving.

definition.zh_def: 知識；對某事物的理解或認識。
definition.en_def: Information, understanding, or awareness gained through experience or education.
definition.example: Her knowledge of history helped her excel in the exam.
